discussion.author: maltezfaria
discussion.text:
[noblock] Automerge fails for two reasons: 

1. The package name is too short.
2. The package name is too close to two other packages (Intan and Ant)

First of all, we like the name `Inti`, and would like to keep it if possible. 

Regarding the name being "close" to Ant and Intan: we don't think this would cause confusion: those packages do very different things. 

Regarding the name being short: Inti is simultaneously similar to "Integral equations", which is what this package solves, and the Incan sun god. We liked the connection since many of the intended applications are related to light propagation (scattering problems). 

Any chance this PR can be manually merged?

discussion.author: ViralBShah
discussion.text: I am not thrilled with the name, but I do agree that it isn't really similar to the other ones. Happy to override this manually, but let's give it a day or so to see what others might have to say.

discussion.author: goerz
discussion.text: [noblock] Based on the explanation in https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/pull/109370#issuecomment-2179348506, the package name falls squarely in the category of "less systematic name" (just like Makie and many other packages). Thus I don't see any reason not to merge this
